title: 70's Ford font
content:
Can anyone ID this font? This is a valve cover for 70's era Ford V8:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100329014023im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PBF%20cover_5820.jpg)

Thanks.
author: ChingChingPow

comments.content:
This is machined lettering designed to be stamped on metal sheets, not a font. The basic style however is a Gothic sans, of which there are many.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks. I do understand that this cover predates computer-based design, but I'm curious if someone else has developed a font simiar to this, or seeing if someone used it as a basis for one. I did discover that the "powered by" lettering looks to be a heavily slanted Haettenschweiler font. The "Ford" lettering is stumping me a bit, but with all the published fonts out there, I'm only looking for one that is close.

Dan, you might be interested to read this piece I wrote: [Not a Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100329014023/http:/www.marksimonson.com/article/251/not-a-font).

(Sorry, I don't have any suggestions for a similar-looking font.)
